column4: to answer my own question from earlier, to get front panel audio working I had to add options snd_hda_intel model=3stack to a file in /etc/modprobe.d/
if anyone syncs home directories between multiple machines, what do you use?
rysnc, or wget depending on whats required
they sync - not keep snapshots
royel: okay.  I was hoping to set up something where one machine keeps differential snapshots and both machines are synced with the current versions.  Kind of like rdiff-backup.
kind of depends on what he is trying to build.  If he'd asked a question instead of pase-flooding it would've been better.
even so - its ubuntu support not software building support, but yes, that would have been a better approach
sorry, I just ate my first homegrown tomato of the summer and lost all track of what you were talking about ;)
yummy, no problem
captainm: there are devices which come up as /dev/sda (or whatever) and not sda1.  I have a usb key like that.
CCmonster: he needs to know what to change it to first.  CCmonster, you may have to scroll down pretty far.
give it a rest.  The ubuntu menu.1st is long and intimidating to a new user.
give what a rest ? its perfectly sound advice
which you've repeated 5 times in increasingly condescending tones.  Obviously your advice isn't appropriate for him.
because he doesn't want to do it, he wants someone to do it for yhim
apologies, I've not seen you ask a question. Go for it
no worries, I haven't asked any tonight.
ahhh I thought you where saying no-one had responded
since I'm often the one giving help here, my questions are a little harder than the average #ubuntu questions ;)
exactly why I was interested
I suffer the same too
